theorem.title: Constant Multiple Rule
theorem.statement: If c is a constant and f is a differentiable function, then \dfrac{d}{dx}[c\cdot f(x)] = c\cdot\dfrac{d}{dx}[f(x)]

subsubsection.p: There are three more important rules:

theorem.title: Sum/Difference Rule
theorem.statement: If f and g are differentiable functions, then \dfrac{d}{dx}[f(x)\pm g(x)] = \dfrac{d}{dx}[f(x)]\pm \dfrac{d}{dx}[g(x)]

question.statement: Restate the sum/difference rule in words.

theorem.title: Product Rule
theorem.statement:
If f and g are both differentiable, then
\dfrac{d}{dx}[f(x)\cdot g(x)] = \dfrac{d}{dx}[f(x)]\cdot g(x) + f(x)\cdot \dfrac{d}{dx}[g(x)]

question.statement: Restate the product rule in words.

theorem.title: Quotient Rule
theorem.statement:
If f and g are both differentiable (with g\neq 0), then
\dfrac{d}{dx}\left[\dfrac{f(x)}{g(x)}\right] = \dfrac{\dfrac{d}{dx}[f(x)]\cdot g(x) - f(x)\cdot \dfrac{d}{dx}[g(x)]}{(g(x))^2}

question.statement: Restate the quotient rule in words.
